What do you guys think of the physics based game portal

I think that it is one of the most ingenious puzzle games of all time.
Awesome Game. Definitely on the level of KSP.

A portal gun in KSP would allow you to create a perpetual motion machine that could easily accelerate objects to far past the speed of light. Plus, in a game where the whole concept is to travel to hard to reach places, a portal gun defeats the entire concept. There is a cool game called mari0 which is basically mario, with a portal gun.

The portals works on a special material made from moon dust only. Normal white surfaces doesn't work. Has to be coated in the special white paints that has the moon dust in it.

I think the portal gun can be quite interesting as a method of space exploration, really. The speed of the portal "projectile" is equal to the speed of light, and has no limit that we know of. Makes a system with a ton of tiny guns like that in a secured place, maybe on the moon, planting one end where they are, and then shooting the other end everywhere in space and then wait till something connects to another body that may have the same make up as the moon, then send a probe over to see things.

True. Here's one.

[http://www.kongregate.com/games/Heaval/portalizer](http://www.kongregate.com/games/Heaval/portalizer)

It has a few bugs, but it's really fun.

Both Portal and Portal 2 were fantastic games, though having completed them I've felt absolutely no reason to replay them. Still though, one of the best uses of 10 hours or so that gaming has given me.

I wouldn't see the point of a portal gun in KSP though, outside of doing it for the sake of doing it.

> 
> The portals works on a special material made from moon dust only. Normal white surfaces doesn't work. Has to be coated in the special white paints that has the moon dust in it.

Pretty sure it does work on all white surfaces, the moon dust gel was just used because it was a good "portal conductor"... and because they're Aperture, I guess ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Honestly, we shouldn't start an argument over a game where you use a little gun to shoot blue energy balls at surfaces and create conveniently human-sized, colored portals on contact.

It is a great game though.

I was reading through some geological field safety thing today as I'm going to Pembrokeshire in a few weeks with my uni, and one of the notable hazards was angry birds (not Angry Birds^TM^) that would attack you if you got too close to the nests.

I seriously couldn't stop from thinking "AH, BIRD, BIRD, AAAAHHH!"

Portal 2 is utterly ingenious in both design and humour.
I have used many hours of my life playing both Portal and Portal 2. These games are superb, in both story writing as well as the numerous puzzles and mysteries throughout the game.
I just bought portal 2 today. Already I am enjoying it quite a bit. Need to go back and play the first at some point.
